intro: Cotula valparadisea, commonly known as the Valparaíso daisy, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its small, daisy-like flowers with white petals and a yellow center. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy or gravelly soils. It has hairy leaves and produces small, inconspicuous fruits. Cotula valparadisea is often used in horticulture for its ornamental value and ability to thrive in coastal environments.
